head.supplied: ¶ List of the plants to be forwarded to England under the care of J. R. Elsey, Esq., being part of the collection of the North Australian Expedition. ¶ Dilleniaceae. ¶ Hibbertia lepidota, R. Br. ¶ ob...

div.p: SRNSW: A4110 [An1-3/13], State Records of New South Wales, Sydney.

No addressee is indicated but M would probably have presented this list to Gregory as part of his reporting on the botany of the North Australian Exploring Expedition.
List of the plants to be forwarded to England under the care of J. R. Elsey, Esq., being part of the collection of the North Australian Expedition.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.4929in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
velutina, Ferd. Mueller
Bentham (1863-78), vol. 1, p. 30 attributes the name to an herbarium specimen collected by Robert Brown (from 'East Coast'; the name is given by Brown on the label of the specimen at the Natural History Museum, BM 551312.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
rigens, Ferd. Mueller
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Cocculus smilacinus, Ferd Mueller
Described as Tinospora smilacina from M's MS name Cocculus
smilacinus in Bentham (1861), p. 52.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
biformis, Ferd. Mueller.
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
glauca, Ferd Mueller
Capparis glauca had already been used for an Indian species by Wallich (1828-1849), no. 7005 (1832). M's specimen sheet using that name is at Kew, K 651049. Bentham (1863-78), vol. 1, p. 96, treated that specimen as a variety, C. canescens var glauca.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
disticha, Ferd. Mueller
Capparis disticha described in Kurz (1874), p. 70, may not be the same species as that so named here but not published by M.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Azadirachta Australasica Ferd. Mueller.
Specimens distributed by M under this name are at Trinity College Dublin (TCD 13568) and Kew (K 695357). At Kew it is filed as Rhodosphaera rhodanthema, to which genus Engler transferred it from M's Rhus rhodanthema, described in B58.04.01, p. 43, the name also used in Bentham (1863-78), vol. 1, p. 489.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Elseya amabilis Ferd. Mueller
M did not erect a genus to honour Joseph Elsey, commemorating him instead in Ripogonum elseyanum (B58.06.01, p. 44).

Hartigshea Hilliana, Ferd Mueller
Hartighsea? There is a sheet, TCD13581, bearing this name in Trinity College Dublin. No Hartighsea named by M has been found (APNI, accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
versicolor, Ferd Mueller.
The name was preoccupied by an 1809 species described by Sims. No record of M's describing a species of Nymphaea has been found (APNI, accessed 21 April 2020).

Triumfetta brevisetea Ferd Mueller.
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
urticifolia, Ferd Mueller
There is specimen distributed under this name at Trinity College Dublin, TCD 13033. The name is not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
brachypoda, Ferd. Mueller
A sheet, K 659470, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is at Kew, with a 1997 label by R. M. Barker, 'Holotype sida cordifolia var ?mutica Bentham' (see Bentham (1863-78), vol. 1, p. 197). It is filed under the current name Sida atherophora subsp. magnifica (see Barker (1988), p. 39).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
villiferum, Ferd Mueller
A sheet, K 659609, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is filed at Kew under the earlier name Abutilon crispum.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
lasiocarpum, Ferd Mueller
There is specimen distributed under this name at Trinity College Dublin, TCD 10654. The name is not in IPNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Abelmoschus hians Ferd. Mueller
A sheet, K 659938, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is filed at Kew under Abutilon rhodopetalus, described by M in B61.02.02, p. 113; it was collected by Hill and Mueller in December 1856 at Brisbane River.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Glycosmis velutina, Ferd. Mll.
A sheet, K 717814, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is filed at Kew under the earlier name of Micromelum minutum.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Boronia velutina Ferd Mueller.
A sheet, K 717129, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is filed at Kew under Boronia lanceolata, which was described by M in B59.02.03, p. 66.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
micrantha, Ferd. Mueller
A sheet, TCD 13067, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is filed at Trinity College Dublin under Boronia occidentalis, a name given in 2003.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Hymenosporum pittosporoides Ferd. Mueller
A sheet, TCD 9995, distributed with M's label bearing this name, is at Trinity College Dublin. Hymenosporum flavum is the only species of this genus that M listed in B82.02.05, a species he described in B60.08.01, p. 77.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Dennisonia nobilis, Ferd. Mll.
M listed the name, without description, in B56.02.01, p. 47; there is a specimen labelled by M with this name, from the Brisbane River, at Trinity College Dublin, TCD 14099.

Cupania Pseudorchus,
Cupania pseudorhus? A. Rich.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
lasiantha, Ferd. Mll
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Pogonanthus multiflorus, Ferd Mueller.
Genus not in IPNI (accessed 21 April 2020). However, there are specimens from the Brisbane River labelled Pogonopetalum multiflorum, which is also a genus name not found published, at Trinity College Dublin (TCD 145095), Melbourne (MEL74652) and Kew (K 739243). It is possible, but by no means certain, that M had changed his mind on the name to use. The Kew specimen, collected by Hill and M, is described as Atalaya multiflora in Bentham (1863-78), vol. 1, p. 463; that is also the name under which the Melbourne sheet is stored.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
micropetalum Ferd. Muell
M's label 'Nephelium (Arytera) micropetalum | ferd Mueller | Moreton Bay' is on the specimens stored as Arytera foveolata at Kew (K 701508) and Melbourne (MEL 1537160). M described it as A. foveolata in B59.13.01, p.24.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
Harmogia linearifolia Ferd. Muell.
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

Camphoromyrtus umbellata Ferd Mueller.
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p:
pedunculatum, Ferd. Mueller.
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;

div.p: and 23 sp either new or imperfectly described.

Angophora rhytiphlaca Ferd Mll.
Not in APNI (accessed 21 April 2020).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0.9862in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: -0.4929in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.5in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.5in;

div.p:
Eugenia polysciada, Ferd Muell.
Two sheets at Kew, K 793790 and K 793791, have M's label with this name, stored under Backhousia citriodora, the name under which M described it in B59.02.03, p. 78.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.5in;

div.p:
capitata Ferd. Muell.
M did not publish a species with this name; Eugenia capitata was used by E. D. Merrill (1917), p. 209, for a species from Sarawak.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 0in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0.5in;

div.p: This index comprises 215 species of plants, belonging to 36 orders of Thalamiflorae with 77 genera, and to 4 orders of Calyciflorae with 23 genera. The collection is accompanied by a set of manuscript, containing the diagnostic of nearly all the new species discovered.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Botanist of the North Australian Expedition.
These plants were received and listed by W. Hooker in July 1857: the two lists are nearly identical (W. Hooker, 'List of Mueller's Australian plants received in July 1857', Plants lists, vol. 1 Europe, Africa, America, Australia, New Zealand, Polynesia, 1845-63, RBG Kew).
See also M to W. Hooker, 6 March 1857.
